intro: Polygala stipulacea, commonly known as the stipulate milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Polygalaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive floral structures and often small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, arranged in racemes, and are adapted for pollination by insects. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a hardy species suitable for dryland environments.
